availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jamerson Hall (Henry County, Kentucky, postmaster and farmer.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, postmaster and farmer. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Married to Lucinda Guinn Hall in Henry County, Kentucky, on February 28, 1855. Father of Mildred Frances Hall, Henry C. Hall, Letitia Hall, Sallie Hall, Mary Hall, and Bland Hall. Served as postmaster in Henry County from May 10, 1854, to September 25, 1857. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 278.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 180B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, Christiansburg Precinct, p. 452B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #99403808, Henry County Marriages.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Henry County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 640.
Kentucky Historical Society, Kentucky Cemetery Records Project: Henry County, Kentucky, Vol. 1 (Frankfort, KY: 1986).
